abstracts.cdata!:
This environmental assessment for the
            Mindanao Rural Development Project details the negative
            environmental impacts resulting from water supply and road
            construction and recommends mitigation measures. Careful
            planning will minimize and offset impairment of cultural and
            historical sites. During the design phase, the area
            surrounding the spring box and reservoir will be fenced to
            prevent traffic by people or stray animals and act as a
            barrier to runoff that could possibly contaminate the
            source. To reduce soil erosion from exposed areas and
            deterioration of water quality, soil filled trenches should
            be compacted and vegetation planted. Flooding of lots and
            farmlands adjacent to roads will be mitigated by carefully
            planning drainage facilities, and including bridges, box
            culverts, reinforced concrete pipes, and side ditches.
            Properly storing spoils and using silting ponds will
            alleviate stream sedimentation. Dust will be controlled by
            spraying road surfaces and imposing speed limits on
            motorists. No protection measures are recommended to
            mitigate against deforestation and other losses of
            agricultural lands and ecology due to road construction, but
            offsetting actions are planned during spring development. To
            prevent social conflict arising from water use distribution,
            limited water rights will be offered. Social inequities
            resulting from resettlement will be checked by careful planning.
